Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for pre cruise travel!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night before going on the Norwegian Pearl on Sunday. A shuttle continuously rounds the airport terminals and we had no trouble finding it. Checkin was a breeze and the room was extremely nice, just like any other marriott room. The staff are eager to please, there is a Starbucks on location, and there is free internet on their own 23" screen computers. The pool was nice and warm, even in November. In addition, you could see planes fly overhead but none were heard during the night. Also, if you need transportation to the cruise terminal on sunday, they offer 3 different shuttle services to the Port of Miami: 11:00 A.M., 12:00 P.M., and 1:00 P.M. for only $11 per person. I highly recommend this hotel and doing this service if you need transportation to the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport and a good gym”
Reviews.Author: Daytona11110
Reviews.Content: If your arrive late at the airport you may choose this hotel. Always nice rooms, we had one on the upper floor. View is not particularly interesting. Good breakfast and a rather developped gym. Parking fee but close to the entrance. Not so easy to find although you can see it from far away. I would use a navigation system.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, customer unfriendly, expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: robsreview
Reviews.Content: -called hotel to get directions since my gps did not take nw lejeune and was not given helpful advice. -when i finally got to the hotel and wanted to return rental car since the rental counter was closed inside the hotel, and was told by hotel front desk to take the car in the back, well there are 3 marrriott hotel parking lots so a large complex and the rental car return location was not marked clearly in the dark so kept driving around-- front desk could have been more helpful. -So finally got to the room and the bathroom had black growth all over the tub therefore did not take shower -asked for milk at the main floor coffee shop and was charged $7

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced!”
Reviews.Author: MooninattheBeach
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable with no repairs needed. Definitely an upper priced hotel. At 180$ per night, I found it a bit steep in price. Not within walking distance of a lot, but the pool is a great place to hang out. We were there just for a day/night between a cruise and flight, so all we really needed was a bed and someplace close to eat. We did eat at a nearby Cuban restuarant so we could experience Cuban cuisine, but wouldn't venture out too far past that.

Reviews.Title: “They oversell rooms and don't honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: STLvagabond
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Rewards member who booked a room at this hotel a month in advance and guaranteed it with a credit card. Obviously, I chose the hotel in large part due to its proximity to the airport and free frequent shuttle service. I was arriving at MIA airport around 10 pm at night and had a flight out the next morning. Everything started well. The hotel shuttle pulled up as soon as I walked out of the airport. On arrival at the hotel, I was impressed with the lobby and lively atmosphere. I was looking forward to checking into my room and trying out the bar/restaurant. When I attempted to check in, the clerk noted my name and attempted to find my room details in the stack of guest folios in front of him. He excused himself for a few minutes and returned to tell me that the hotel was "oversold" and there was no room for me. This was despite me holding an email confirmation saying that I had a "confirmed" room guaranteed by credit card. I accepted his news and did not put up an argument like most people would, in part because he told me I would just be staying right next door at the Courtyard Marriott. The clerk asked me to sit on the couch in the lobby for a few minutes. I did so. I watched other guests check in during this time. I have no idea why there reservations were honored by mine was not. The clerk then brought me paperwork for the free room at the Courtyard Marriott. He told me that the Courtyard Marriott was next door in the same complex and that I simply had to walk down the hall, take a left, and then take a right out the double doors and walk by the pool and I would be in the Courtyard Marriott. I did so. I waited in line to check in at the Airport Courtyard Marriott and handed over my "free room" paperwork. The Courtyard Marriott folks looked at the paperwork with puzzled looks and then told me the truth: I was actually being sent to the Downtown Courtyard Marriott, a 15 minute taxi ride away. The downtown Courtyard Marriott is an inferior property in an urban environment next to a loud, busy street. The Airport Marriott did pay for my stay there and the (one way) taxi fare downtown. However, I wasn't looking for a free stay at an inferior property far from the airport and one way taxi fare to get there. All I wanted and expected was for the Airport Marriott to honor the reservation that I guaranteed with a credit card, so that I could get a full night's sleep before my flight the next day. If that's what you expect from a hotel, I suggest that you book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TheStarr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located near the airport and walking distance from some nice restaurants. The staff are welcoming and eager to please. The rooms are clean and fresh. Perfect place to stay as a stopover. Pool and patio area is relaxing and pretty. GREAT gym facilities!!! It is expensive but worth staying in such a pleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, horrible food (room service)”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel on 3 occasions due to late flights into Miami. A great location for the airport. The staff is very friendly, and the hotel is ok (rooms are ok, bathrooms are nothing special). Guests seem to walk to their rooms somewhat loudly at night so there's a little noise (maybe they've had some drinks at the trendy bar in the lobby). We had room service on our most recent stay and it was downright horrible--$36 for a chicken Cesar salad and a chicken sandwich and the food quality was really, really bad. I have mixed feelings about this hotel--will likely try another property next time.

Reviews.Title: “very nice Marriott, right at the airport”
Reviews.Author: scrutineer44
Reviews.Content: The Miami airport Marriott is a very nice hotel. A little upper average for the full name brand in fact. Restaurant, lobby and bar are high points. the concierge lounge on the seventh floor is rather small however and a bit on the plain side. hotel has $15 per day parking (!) and internet for a fee in rooms, free in the main lobby downstairs. the courtyard next door and this hotel seem to share facilities for pool and gym. i would go back to this hotel. depending on which way the airport traffic goes, you'll hear the air traffic very loudly right over your head.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every Way”
Reviews.Author: papula65
Reviews.Content: We chose this Marriott for a pre-cruise stay. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. From the shuttle that transported us from the airport to the hotel, to the shuttle to the port, everything was great. The grounds were beautifully maintained,the room was large and spotless, and the service was impeccable! The two meals we had in the restaurant were excellent. I highly recommend the Airport Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Stone's throw from airport”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter77777
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it is clean, comfortable. Super close to the airport. However, the traffic is a bit tricky around it and we definitely needed GPS to find it. Restaurant on site is not great. No good places to eat around the area either. You needed to drive to find something decent around. No much to do on the premise. The pool is not bad though

Reviews.Title: “Looks great! Service is so-so.”
Reviews.Author: nsipod
Reviews.Content: LOOK AND FEEL UPON ARRIVAL: I arrived here 2 days ago for a business trip. The front lobby looks great! I heard they went through a renovation, and the front lobby has a very "cool" and south beach/miami type of theme. I think a lot of people would be impressed. Unfortunately, the main restaurant and bar are open and appear to be part of the lobby. I prefer it when a restaurant is separated so I dont see incoming guests watching me dine. The Fire Grill restaurant that they have in the lobby is not that great and I dont recommend eating here. I had a gnocchi for $19, but it was probably worth about $12. The alcohol was overpriced as well. CHECK IN: The check in experience was not good at all. The line for check in was VERY long. There were only 2 people trying to check in a line of about 40 guests. The process took about 45 minutes to get through. If you are coming to this hotel, do not arrive between 6-8PM on a weekday. The staff was polite and very nice, but I felt as though they should be quicker and more accommodating to guests requests. ELITE MEMBERS: There is a lounge (evening snacks, dessert, and breakfast), but thats about it when it comes to benefits. I am an elite member and was not offered an upgrade. There are 3 levels of business rooms, and even when I asked, I was told nothing was available. Instead, I was placed in a "Pure Room", which I will discuss later. I know the place looked busy, but I also know that the place was not at full capacity. LOUNGE FOR ELITE MEMBERS: Weekdays, its open from 5-10PM, I believe. The first day, there was some chicken thing, 3 types of cheeses and saltines, pretzels, coffee, and soda+water. Unfortunately, the chicken dish had pretty much run out by the time I saw it, and no one refilled it for the 20 minutes that I was there (I figured that they were instructed to just refill it every hour or something, I dont know). The attendant was very nice though, and seemed to enjoy talking to guests and keeping everyone happy. The lounge is physically small and cramped. If you go for breakfast, be there early enough to get a table. There is only 1 computer as well, so be ready to wait your turn. Breakfast was a little disappointing. They had bagels, some danishes (once again, they had run out by the time I saw them), fruit (which was really good), cereal (lots of selection), juices, coffee, and oatmeal. Most of the marriott breakfasts I go to seem to have more options. The only real issue I had with the lounge was the small size and that the staff did not refill items very quickly. ROOMS: I am an elite member and was given a basic room on the 6th floor. This is a "PURE" room, which is supposed to be allergy free/etc. The room was clean and nice, and it had a good view of Miami. The bed was nice and soft, room was clean and had a good feel, and the bathrooms were clean and spacous. Like other guests have mentioned, the walls are a little thin and you can hear people walking around the halls. Unfortunately, on either side of me were families with little kids who were yelling and screaming all night. -- I had one major issue with my room as well. The KEY LOCK on the room ended up having a low battery. I first got into my room and it worked just fine. I put my stuff inside and went to the lounge, but when I came back, the key didnt work. I went to the downstairs lobby and got another key (I thought it may have been my fault). The second key didnt work. I went back down and got a third key. This worked and I was able to change my clothes for dinner. When I came back, my key didnt work again. I went to the lobby again and asked for another key. At this point, I also requested a room change (but was denied. Not sure why, and was more disappointed). I was told that, "maybe the battery is low and security will come check". I got another key and got into my room. Security called my room and said, "are you in?" Yes, Im inside. "Okay, it works then. bye." Well, the next day, my key didnt work again!!! I requested a room change again, but was denied. The lobby person came upstairs with me, and even his master-key didnt work!!! I went back up to the lounge for a few minutes, and security came over and said, "your key and lock are fine. there is no problem". After 7 keys, I didnt believe him, but also didnt have the patience to deal with it any more. I just ended up leaving my room unlocked for the remainder of the time that I was there. It is very unfortunate that this Marriott has not learned how to treat their guests with a little more understanding and provide a quicker resolution. PARKING: Its always full and you need your room key to get in and out. Half the people who were there didnt seem to have working keys, so you had to wait to get out. This is the hotel's fault and they really should come up with another solution. My recommendation is to have one staff member there at all times. CONCLUSION: I might stay here again, but I would be very reluctant. I would NOT eat here again (Miracle Mile is 10 minutes away and has good restaurants - take a cab). Prior to checking in, I would call the hotel and verify that the room Im getting is on a better floor and away from kids with allergies. I would not use the pool (it is very small and shared with the Courtyard Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Miami Airport location”
Reviews.Author: Gendreauj
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Cold swimming pool. Not near any good restaurants,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the worst airport Marriott I haw ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Cuffy01
Reviews.Content: I am now on my third room. The first 2 doors down from the ice machine and elevator. Sounded as though both were in my room. Complained and was moved to the "Concierge" floor. You know the one for loyal Marriott Rewards patrons. Went to dinner and came back to noise next door and in the halls. You know, those elite teenage travelers that spend 75 nights a year at Marriotts were having fun at my expense. Then went into the bathroom to find the ceiling leaking. Again called to complain and now "upgraded" to a junior suite facing the parking lot and at ground level. Waiting for the first car to start up and awaken me at 5:00 AM. By the way I will spend over 130 nights this year at Marriots all over the world. This is by far the absolute worst experience in years.

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad...”
Reviews.Author: angelmer
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I was immediately impressed. The lobby was gorgeous and looked as though they took great pains in the remodel. The lobby restaurant was very good and free breakfast with my package was amazing! Staff seemed to be a litle short at front desk as there was always a wait to speak with someone. However, they were always friendly and helpful once you got them. There were computer terminals in the lobby and fresh cold water by the elevator. There also always seemed to be an elevator waiting for me. When I got to my room, things were a little lower class but not horrible. The bathroom though was less than wonderful. It was indeed very small. The tub took up the bulk of the space. The ceiling tiles were stained and ill-fitting. I don't understand why a hotel would spend good money to redo some aspects and not others?! Get rid of the tub and put in a nice stall shower and you'd free up space in the bathroom making it much better. The gym was better than a lot I've seen but it was in a different building! This is not so bad going but the last thing I want to do after sweating for an hour is go outside while still wet. Internet was not free but ran about $18/day with tax. Even low class places give you free wifi. For the price, I'd think it could be included but...Overall, this was my first trip to Miami and was a pre-cruise stay. The location was very good as I walked to do some shopping and felt completely safe. I might stay again but would probably look around some more first.

Reviews.Title: “Great cruise package hotel”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Although we were allocated a very poor room on arrival (next to lift and power room) the other reception girl changed our room once we complained to a similar room but without the problems of noise from the two sources. Courtesy bus from the airport and then to the cruise port. Excellent buffet breakfast with package. Free computers in the lobby with free internet use. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Newly remodelled gem close to Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: The Airport Marriott is newly remodeled property â€“ I have stayed here quite a few times and am actually quite surprised by the negative comments as I find the hotel excellent value and superb in terms of convenient location to the scareport. I have generally found the front desk fairly slow and laid back, but not this time - they were slick and I was checked in, in minutes. Thank goodness the remodeling is over, but it has paid off â€“ it is an old building but they have done a great job of remodeling. The lobby and bar are very modern â€“ the sportsbar Champions is right off the lobby and their restaurant is called Cane Fire Grill â€“ serves OK middle of the road priced food. The rooms have been very well remodeled with large practical bathrooms and are clean, cool and comfortable. What fascinates me though is the inconsistency in the Marriott brand â€“ when I stay at full service Marriott, I expect a gown, and bathroom amenities to include cotton buds â€“ but not here. I also asked for a room on a high floor and didnâ€™t get it, with the number of nights I spend annually at Marriott â€“ in excess of 150 â€“ I expect to get what I want! My stay however was great and I can thoroughly recommend this property as the best option close to Miami Scareport. They run a shuttle service every 15 minutes to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bland Brand”
Reviews.Author: Constant_traveller45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, before and after a trip to Cuba. Marriott's are (intentionally?) bland but this one is the worst I have experienced. Expect a lot of beige and plain bad taste. But, and stand warned, expect incredibly expensive meals and bar tabs. And the least friendly Starbucks I have yet encountered. So save money, save the assault on your taste and your wallet and find another hotel when forced to spend the night at Miami International.

Reviews.Title: “An Olde, but Goode. Renovated and a Very Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: STLRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property for a few years now. I'm a Marriott Platinum and my stays are for business. This property has been around for many years, but is "an Olde, but Goode" and has been nicely renovated. It is a Very Good Place to Stay; obviously convenient to the airport , convenient to all highways, easy to get to the beaches if you want to break away and other places for some fun. Little Havana is easy to get to from the hotel. Go south and a left turn on 8th St (US HWY 41). You'll know when you get there. I usually hub out of this property when visiting clients to the south and to the north. Non-business stay should be cost effective and enjoyable too. They do have a very nice pool and various outside lounge areas that can distract and take you away from where you are actually staying, i.e. close to the airport. I think would works well for R&R for short term or maybe a week when looking for a full service hotel and not willing to pay resort prices. Staying at this property is always very interesting because of all the international guests that come and go It's almost as if your were staying in another country, i.e. South America for example. And that only adds to the enjoyment of staying at this property. The hotel lobby and the rooms have been very nicely renovated. I've never experienced any issues. The concierge Lounge and staff is always very nice and friendly. It's one of the few properties that doesn't lock the doors at 10PM sharp and so if coming in later you can usually grab a desert and coffee if running late. (not the norm and no guarantee, but they do attempt to leave the door open while staying to clean the lounge before leaving for the night.} The staff is customer focused. Close to the airport, but noise from the airport doesn't filter into the rooms too badly at all and I've never had a night where airport noised was an issue. Always a nice night's sleep. No guarantee that you can't get rude guests that come in and out every so often, especially more on a weekend stay than mid week, but that can happen at any property. Should that happen the staff is responsive to try to resolve any rude guests. The hotel restaurant is very good and the staff is very attentive. I've gotten to know Ira, who mans the bar and has been there for over 25 years. He's always friendly and makes my stay that much more enjoyable. I believe much of the staff are long timers. The staff is wonderful at this property and all seem very happy, which attests to the many who have been on staff for many years. The rooms are very nice, renovated and always maintained. Typical Marriott business hotel rooms. Nothing more to add here. I always stay on the Concierge level, as they always upgrade Plats, etc. Look for deals on the Marriott website that offer free self parking and it will save you a few bucks each day. Usually under a AAA rate or search the deals and promotions. The property is actually a compound or sorts and shares property with Courtyard and Residence Inn. There is a Fairfield Inn adjacent too, but is outside of the property grounds. This Marriott might look old from the outside and shows an older buildout Marriott Airport look, but don't get fooled... This is a very nice property and recommend it. Only giving a Very Good and not excellent rating because trying to be totally objective in that this is an older property and at the airport, but this is an excellent property all around in my opinion. Note: Le Jeune Road is usually very busy, so just be careful, especially when turning left out of the property and going south. Lot's ot toll roads in FL, so if you come here frequently and dirve, get a Sun Pass.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: Incompetent check in staff. Terrible room service food. Bathroom not clean. No hot water in the morning (6:00 a.m.) Staff arguing amongst selves at check out. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby -- Dodgy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Viento_lleve-me
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott points person because I like the chain. The points program is great and the hotels almost always meet a minimum standard. At this hotel the lobby was beautiful, but the room was not great. It was well cleaned, but just very old. I read an earlier comment that they're upgrading the rooms. if they do as good a job on the rooms as they did the lobby, this will be a great hotel. Until then, dont be surprised if it disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “I've expected more!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanaStr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and it has a nice lobby where you can find a Starbucks.I was a little bit disapointed with the room, which I considered quite old and small. I think a Marriot should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run”
Reviews.Author: sailorjoec
Reviews.Content: From the moment you get there, you can tell that this is a nice place, greet you warmly at front desk, explain all the offerings and you are on your way to your room; This is a huge Marriott campus with a Marriott, a Courtyard, A fairfield & a Residence Inn so it was easy to get buses, something to eat, etc. One of the things I really liked was the gated self park, using your room key, one flat fee, no hassle When in Miami, if ya got business near the airport, this is THE place to stay! (only issue:no Hotel Guide in the room, never brought one either/minor)

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place!”
Reviews.Author: KeysTravelerK
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome!!! I tried many times to find a place to send my accolades to the Marriott team, but their websites do not offer this feature. So I am happy to share my great experience with Trip Advisor. From the check in to the folks in housekeeping, the server in the restaurant, to the attendant at the Concierge level (I wrote down the names but have long lost the paper) - what great hospitality professionals! Your team is awesome! I work at a Resort myself, and I truly appreciate good service by people who care. The facility is simple but very clean and has everything you need - nice pool, clean, comfortable rooms, safe and secure location, and seriously fabulous service. Everyone went above and beyond to assist and make our stay pleasant. I can not recommend this place enough for a quick stop before or after a flight. Way to go - excellent place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older Marriott”
Reviews.Author: tlccva
Reviews.Content: Value was great due to lower price. Room was nice but due to age bathroom was small. Airport transportation ran every 15 minutes and was very efficient. As an airport hotel, it worked well for an overnight stay. Marriott quality was obvious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Food Ever”
Reviews.Author: VTY_IpseDixit
Reviews.Content: Great service, room, extra towels as requested and fast, efficient shuttle service from/to airport. Beautiful lobby. The room was very clean as were all the common areas. The restaurant was a nice surprise. We were tired from a week-long vacation and had a lay-over in Miami before flying home. Our waiter Noel, was upbeat, friendly and gave us great service. The food was delicious, plentiful and well-priced; hats off to the chef!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel by airport.”
Reviews.Author: clamesa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, clean and quiet. We got stuck at the airport due Hurracaine Irine and got a discount to go to this hotel. The shuttle came so often, almost every 15 mins. Check in was quick. The staff was friendly. We had dinner there, little expensive but nice food. The room was very clean, quit an with at nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other airport hotels we have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: listentothisadvice
Reviews.Content: We were booked here for meetings and received a group rate. The rooms were average for an airport hotel, nothing special, carpet needs to be cleaned and room updated. Beds were not very comfortable but all the extra pillows were nice. The bathroom was tiny as if they constucted the hotel then remembered a bathroom was needed in each room! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in giving directions to nearby attractions. The gym was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripwilmington
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is on a campus with Fairfield and Courtyard. We spent 5 days here, 2 for a conference and the rest for pleasure. The nicest part of this hotel is a very pleasant staff, everyone was cheerful and helpful. Location is easy to get to South Beach, Coconut Grove or Coral Gables all of which we visited by our car. We also thought the price was quite reasonable. The workout area is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel by airport”
Reviews.Author: kalua80
Reviews.Content: the hotel was wonderful, clean and quiet. We got stuck at the airport and we're sent to this hotel. The shuttle came so often, almost every 15 mins. Check in was quick. The rooms were as you would imagine in a marriot. They had 4 computers in the lobby with free internet but they were hard to get as there was always someone on them (maybe because of so many canceled flights). The staff was friendly. The breakfast was super good although really expensive. Our friends went to a little cuban restaurant close to the gas station (right beside the hotel) and apparently was really good and super cheap. Over all, I totally recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay by the airport”
Reviews.Author: patriciaDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night between flights and it was very good. We took a free shuttle to/from the airport that runs every 15 minutes. We had 2 nice connecting rooms. Not a JW quality by it was nice. Could do and update with the towels and bed sheets, but we knew this was no luxury hotel so this is what we expected. The restaurant on the 1st floor was extremely expensive (US$ 28 for a fetuccine !!) with not good food or service, they took a lot of time to serve us. Would stay here again if we need to stay for 1 night in between flights but if we need to stay for longer would definitely look for a place by the beach with better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately visit again!”
Reviews.Author: CJMRED
Reviews.Content: We agree with so many other comments on Trip Advisor. This is an excellent hotel with comfortable rooms, VERY friendly staff and an excellent reliable hotel shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: mkathy78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Nice and Quiet. Very comfortable beds. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Business traveler..this is your hotel”
Reviews.Author: K2indy
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff is courteous and attentive. This is a necessity for business travelers. The shuttle runs every 15 mins on the hour. Rooms are quiet. The lobby area is spacious and comfortable. If you need to "lay-over" to catch an international flight, this hotel should be part of your itinerary. Cheers, K2

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: KBM212
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel that becomes EXCELLENT when you factor in the very helpful staff. Hertz counter in the hotel so you can return your rental car without going to the airport and Starbucks in the lobby along with good reasonably priced restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: rkecat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights in January prior to a cruise along with several friend who were also cruising with us. The airport shuttle was quick and easy. The lobby is gorgeous and the room and bathroom seemed normal hotel size to me. I'm wondering if there are different sized rooms since there are so many complaints of small bathrooms. The bedding was also very nice and comfortable. All the staff from the front desk to the restaurant were great. The water dispenser by the elevators with fruit was a nice touch and was refreshing after coming in from the warm weather to be able to grab some water. Our rate included breakfast. It was good, but I probably wouldn't pay $20+ for a breakfast buffet normally. The food was good and the service excellent, I just don't eat that much for breakfast to make it worthwhile for me if it weren't included in the rate. Some others in our party ate at the little Cuban place right outside the front gate and raved about how good and inexpensive it was. We also had a lovely lunch in the Cane Fire restaurant that actually cost less than the breakfast would have! We also really enjoyed the pool area and some much needed warm weather! We had dinner one night at Champions in the Courtyard next door which was pretty good. Our server was a bit overwhelmed since there was some sort of big football game on and it was extremely crowded and loud in there. I would eat there again as long as there wasn't a big game on since it was too loud to have a conversation at the table. There's not a lot in the immediate area but there is a shopping center with a K-mart and a Walgreens within about a 10 minute walk. We headed out mid day on a Saturday to pick up some sodas and snacks. A word of caution here - the neighborhood behind the hotel leading to this shopping center is a bit rough. I'm sure there are much worse in Miami, but four of us walking (including two large guys) became uncomfortable very quickly. We stuck to the main roads on our walk back and they were fine so you might want to go that route when walking. Cruise shuttle the day of our departure was a breeze. We had tickets included in the cruise package and others in our group purchased them for $11 per person. The shuttle was right on time and an easy and efficient way to get to the port. Overall, I'd defintely stay again at the Marriott or at one of the other hotels in the complex. I just wish their rates hadn't more than doubled for next January as I'd really like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: CharleneGoes
Reviews.Content: The service begins with a shuttle from the airport. We missed one but another came by promptly. We stopped to pick up other passengers. Two had booked with other hotels. One had to wait an hour for her shuttle. The other found out her hotel didn't even offer one. Score one for Miami Marriott. The staff is extremely friendly. We even got free Mojitos at the door that were delicious! Hungry we opted for Champions restaurant located a short walk in the adjacent hotel. The Champion sampler was phenominal. It fed three of us for $35 with food left over for later. Only complaint was waitress took our payment and we asked for change which she only gave back to one of our party. I had to go to the bar and request it. Hotel is Worth the price. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location near airport - otherwise typical airport Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Qflyer
Reviews.Content: Nothing special at all about this hotel - except that it's really close to the airport and has a free shuttle. Spent a night "in transit" so fit my requirements perfectly - got to the hotel in 10 minutes at night and back to the airport in 10 minutes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbershopperDC
Reviews.Content: My family and I got "stuck" at the Miami Airport Marriott due to the large fire at the airport, but we enjoyed our extended stay. The good: nice updated hotel lobby, great breakfast buffet (was included in our rate - search for the package!), very friendly waiters (which expect to be tipped big, though), decent pool (although they squandered more pool space by having a super large pool patio), great super-modern Champions bar in the adjacent Courtyard Marriott (which appears to be the better deal - same amenities and more modern rooms). Free internet in the hotel lobby. Reliable shuttle service to the airport every 15 minutes. The bad: room are simply too small and this includes the tiny bathrooms; signs of wear and tear in places. The hairdryer died on me, which wasn't a surprised given the age of the room. A/C was hard to get right. Super uncomfortable rollaway bed for which there was almost no floor space. Guests can be a bit nasty (we had some college kids hanging out by the pool and a wedding party with truly obnoxious people making noise past midnight), but alas no noise in the hotel corridors. There is a rental car company located in the lobby but they had no cars while we were there, which should not be happening. Hotel receptionist made the mistake of extending our stay by only one instead of two nights, which could have ended in a disaster (they kept running out of available rooms). Despite the flaws, I'm looking forward to staying at this Marriott although I might check out the Courtyard Marriott next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, good location easy to access both airport and cruise ship port.”
Reviews.Author: webtravelreview
Reviews.Content: We used the free shuttle from the airport which took about 20 minutes to get us. Upon arrival, we checked in to our room which was ready and what we asked for, 2 beds on a quiet side of the hotel. We ate in the neighboring hotels Champions for a late lunch early dinner. It was just ok, a bit expensive for basically bar food. The landscaping of the pool area was lovely. I sat in a lounge chair and relaxed while my kids played around the area. The hotel is older but has been updated. The lobby was quiet modern and nice. The beds were super comfy and I am picky. The shower had great water pressure. The room was a bit small but fine for an overnight stay. We got a great rate through Priceline. I do recommend this hotel for a family of 4. There is a Starbucks in the hotel, which is a huge plus for me as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Redsox0407
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel since it was close to the airport & are partial to Marriott properties....plus our flight got in close to midnight. The shuttle was just pulling away as we got outside, but didn't wait more than 5 minutes for the next one. The front desk staff was very friendly & the check-in process went very smooth. The room was clean & at first we didn't think there were room darkening shades either, but they were there, just pushed all the way back. The next morning we had breakfast in the restaurants & it was delicious! The staff was great & the menu had a nice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Fine choice if you are near the airport”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight at the Miami airport for a business meeting nearby the following day. The hotel was just fine. Only negative was the view of the air conditioning unit on the roof, but we weren't there for the view. We'll stay there again when we are on the way to Latin America, since most of the major cities require us to connect, and Miami is more convenient than other options. For an overnight and quick shot back to the airport, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre or post-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keithandmissy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to leaving on a cruise from the Port of Miami. This hotel was perfect. The beds were very comfortable, the hotel is well-designed, and it is very clean. The service was alright, but not exactly to the standard I am used to at the Marriott chain. The swimming pool is resort-style and shared by the other hotels next door (also of the Marriott brands). We had a great breakfast in the restaurant on-site and enjoyed the buffet as well as a la carte orders. For the price we paid on Hotwire we would stay here again. However, to pay more we would probably reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: autumnway
Reviews.Content: We did not stay here but had a few hours to kill flying home. We stopped here to eat at Cane fire grill. They kept our bags and we had a great breakfast buffet. Sharon was the manager on duty and let us hang out in the lounge, gave us control of the tv and checked on us regularly for drinks. Everyone who helped us were really nice and we couldn't have asked for brute service. We were a group of 7 who work in retail banking with very high service standards and expectations. Thank you Cane fire grill, Marriot and especially sharon and her team serving us.

Reviews.Title: “great place to saty”
Reviews.Author: mmm088
Reviews.Content: great hotel, the only thing is i requested 2 double beds to find out they only have kingsize, but the hotel brought up a roll-away, great service and the sports bar has very good food

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: Sophia4
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just for a night going back from my vacation. Reasonably good airport hotel. Provides airport shuttle; on the way in, you just stand on the curb on the 2nd floor of the airport and wave down red and white Marriott shuttle, there is no special marked place. Lots of peoples stayed there before their cruises. They have hypoallergenic rooms with air filtering machines. I thought that price was a little high for an airport hotel, comparing to similar airport hotels in LA or Atlanta where I stayed before, I believe they were also Marriott, they were half the price and actually a little nicer. I paid over $200 for the room here, it's true I booked a little late, but it wasn't much cheaper earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Great airport pit-stop with free shuttle service! The hotel was quiet and I did not hear any airplanes or cars inside my room. Clean, comfortable, and spacious rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful at ALL hours of the late night and morning! The restaurant inside the lobby was fantastic for breakfast. I hope to stay here again and use the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Stay and rent a car in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUZUKIJR
Reviews.Content: I and my pregnant wife stayed 3 days in Miami for shopping. I preferred this hotel because some facilities for me and my wife: close to the airport, free shuttle each 15 min to the airport and a Hertz rent a car just in the Marriott hotel. There are 3 hotels all together, but Hertz is in the Marriott . The Hertz branch works from 08:00 to 4:00 pm, but it is possible to drop off the keys after 4:00 pm in a box located in Hertz front desk. If you want to rent a car with GPS, contact them before. I had to wait 45 min to have one, because on Hertz website didn't offer me this option to this location and the attendant had to request one. I liked very much this facility to deliver the car in the hotel without going out to other places. Marriott staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “NO Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: samgogh
Reviews.Content: As a business traveller, it was a dissappointment not to get free internet. We are in year 2010 and still charging guests for internet is unacceptable. The pick up and drop to airport was free - the hotel being close to the airport was an advantage. I reached the hotel past midnight and did not get any option for food. Had to checkout early morning for my flight and did not get to eat breakfast. Management could put in a snack basket in the room like many other hotels do globally. Caution: Never make an international call (however short) from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for travel, but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: vankent
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay at this Marriott and chose it primarily for the location since I was cruising from the Port of Miami. It was a great location, but I did not find it to be up to the standards of most other Marriott hotels. The bathroom was unusually small and we found it to be a bit cramped. I woke up one morning and noticed a cockroach was on the ceiling. My stay was booked through JetBlue (book 2 nights and get one free). The free night was added to my bill at checkout, which was corrected once I brought it to their attention. The parking rates and procedure for getting in and out of the parking lot was not explained when I checked in ($15.00/day). The wireless internet information was not posted in the room or explained when I checked in ($14.99/day). The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Super tiny bathrooms, sad view, but awesome fittness room and front desk.”
Reviews.Author: kmfeltes
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is probably the best in the area for airport convenience, (unless you wanted to spend the money for the Dorral Resort & Spa) it was a bit disappointing for a Marriott. The room was on the small side with simple bed, desk, and wingback chair. The view however, while you can see a partial backdrop of city lights, what the whole side of the hotel I am on looks at the other side of the U into hotel rooms, with large industrial fans for the cooling units beneath. Recomend asking for pool side room. The biggest complaint is the micro bathroom. Be prepared to brush against the toilet to get into the bath. The same if you want to be even with center of the sink. They also only provide 2 large towels... may want to ask for more right away. There is no in room coffee machine (however they have a Starbucks in the lobby). Also not provided was a luggage holder in our room. Made due with the footstool. Decor was dated, with green carpet, yellow bedskirt, and a palmtree printed old chair. On the high side, the front desk was very helpful with resteraunt suggestions as well as directions. The fitness room was also state of the art. Lobby was very pluch and trendy... pity it didn't carry over to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kareno27
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice hotel, comfortable rooms. Variety of places to eat...we loved the Sports Bar. Free shuttle from and to the airport...very convenient. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “OK for quick business travel (but likely won't stay again)”
Reviews.Author: LeighBC
Reviews.Content: This did not feel like a Marriott; more like a step down from the typical Marriott. Staff were...okay...but not very responsive or helpful. I was there for business and it was okay but not anything special. I'd not stay again...however, in their defense, from some other people around for business, this seems to be a standard for Miami hotels. Another business traveler said that they had to request items from their hotel 2-3 before getting them and that the staff were not helpful at all. Good: Room Temp, location, good directions (card) from front desk to Miami Beach from hotel So-so: No apples at front desk (thought this was a Marriott standard?) Bad: No free parking ($15/day), there were beetles in the restaurant and when I stated it, staff said "It's where we are", you can see the hotel from the airport - but hard to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley1804
Reviews.Content: Stayted for two nights at the Marriot at front and end of holiday (drove up to Disney). Both nights had a great stay. When we first checked in on 24th July after a 9 hour flight had a bit of a nightmare finding the hotel (sat nav address wrong) The reception staff couldn't find our booking which I had made thhrough Hotels.com, guy was really helpful though and asssured us it wasn't a problem, helpful after stressy journey and 3 very tired young kids. Room was great, two queen beds. Used the pool on return stay, kids loved it. Again room we had was great. We ate on both occassions in Champions at the Courtyard by Marriott more kid friendly then restuarent in the lobby (Cane Fire?) which was fine dinning. Good free internet access in the lobby, good for amusing kids when we had to wait for our flight. On return stay drove down to South Beach for a few hours and found somewhere to have breakfast. South Beach not far only 20 mins away by car. Hotel let us check out late on Sunday too which was good. All in all do not have a bad thing to say about this hotel, frendly all you need for a couple of nights stay and kids loved it too which always helps. Would not hesitate to stay here again if we get the oppurtunity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Dylly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our trip to the Bahamas and on our way to Europe. It was just an overnight, but it was a good experience. The staff was nice and helpful, shuttles on time, very clean rooms and a Starbucks on site. What more could we ask for? This was a reasonably priced, good place to stay when in the Miami airport area. We have stayed at other hotels near the airport and will return here for a number of reasons, mostly the cleanliness of the rooms and ease of getting to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: apperley17
Reviews.Content: We were placed here for one night by a cruise company when our ship broke down at sea. We got off to a poor start - the rooms were not ready and we were expected to sit in the lobby for up to 6 hours whilst people rushed round desperately trying to allocate rooms. This was disappointing as they must have been aware that around 200 people were about to descend on them. However, given that there were a lot of angry adults and upset children, the hotel staff coped extremely well. The staff were polite and helpful - trying to get those with children who hadn't slept in 24 hours into rooms as quickly as possible. We were happy to wait by the pool (which wasn't great - bit small and murky), and the lady on reception was so grateful that she upgraded our room. The rooms were fairly average for a Marriott. Big bed, nice flat screen tv, clean bathroom. The air con was ok, just a little loud. We ate in the restaurant in the evening. The food was good, although we made what must be a very common mistake - we asked for steak and chips. Of course, our beautiful steaks came with crisps, not chips. The waiter happily changed them though. Breakfast was also perfectly adequate - a buffet with fruit, pastries and cooked meat/eggs etc. The lobby appeared to have been renovated fairly recently as the walls, paint, chairs and tables etc looked in very good condition. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want to get out and about in Miami as it is a good 20 minutes drive away (and considerably further from Miami beach), however, this is perfectly good for a night before a flight / joining a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: We-Travel-The-World
Reviews.Content: The Pros â€“ The check-in was fast and the front desk personnel were friendly. The room was very spacious. The beds were comfortable. There was good counter space in the bathroom. The desk area was big enough to work on the laptop and do business. There were ample outlets for the laptop, recharging batteries, etc. The restaurant food and beverages were very good. The Cons â€“ The walls were very thin and you could hear a lot noise from the street. The Internet service was not free. The door frame in the bathroom was very dirty. Cleaning staff did not pay attention to detail. There was no microwave or mini-fridge which was inconvenient. View was the roof of the next building. Although the food and drinks were good, the service in the restaurant was very slow. Also, the music in the restaurant was much too loud. It was hard to hold a conversation with the people at your table. Although having a Starbucks in the lobby was nice, it closed much too early which was not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but with some Problems”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight stopover arriving at MIA after midnight. The hotel shuttle was quick and efficient. The hotel was a 5 minute drive and the courteous driver offered a bottle of water upon entry into the shuttle. Check in was quick and the front desk staff very nice. The hotel is simply beautiful. My bed was very comfortable. BUT.... the curtains were made in such a a way as so that wouldn't close all the way and you had a good 6 feet of nothing but those flimsy white curtains. The lights from the parking lot shown brightly into the room all night which was a real problem for me. I am one of those people who need darkness to sleep. The next morning, I ate at the buffet which was acceptable but extremely overpriced at over $20. The return shuttle was quick and again the driver was pleasant. I can not recommend this hotel to anyone who needs darkness to sleep and I would not recommend anyone eat at the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LYNNEHAMPSHIRE
Reviews.Content: Had been holidaying in Grand Bahama and was sent here by Virgin Holidays due to the Volcanic ach cloud. Rooms spotlessly clean, beds comfortable, Food good. The staff were sympathetic to our predicament and were really friendly. One waitress even said we could borrow her library card to get some books for our daughter who had run out of reading material. We all felt sad when we finally had to leave ! A great and unexpected stay !

Reviews.Title: “Good- typical Marriott, good location at airport”
Reviews.Author: AOC59
Reviews.Content: Pretty typical Marriott. Clean, updated. Stayed there to avoid long trip to airport. Got a 1/2 price via priceline. Starbucks & restaurant in Lobby. Bar/cafe in adjacent Marriott Courtyard. Bar/Cafe food limited and very mediocre. Nice fitness center. Only real complaints: no free wifi in rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great place to use when trapped by a volcano!”
Reviews.Author: Cazz001
Reviews.Content: Due to the Icelandic volcano eruption, our flight was delayed and we were whisked away to the Marriott Airport Hotel. It's approximately 10 mins at the most from the airport and there are regular shuttles to and from the hotel. The reception was very warm and we were dealt with very quickly and efficiently. The room was pretty spacious for an airport hotel and had a large, very clean bathroom with shower/bath, loo and sink. There was adequate wardrobe space a queen sized bed, numerous drawes and a huge T.V which had Sky. For an additional charge you could use the internet in your room but we didn't as there was free internet access in the hotel lobby and seating area. As there were three of us, we phoned down tor reception to see if they had an extra bed that could be placed in the room. Within minutes a huge rollabed was delivered and assembled by the maid. It was a proper bed and very comfortable indeed; when they had said a rollabed, I thought they'd bring a thick mattress!!! Maid service was speedy and they came everyday to replace shampoos etc and generally tidy and empty bins. All the hotel staff were wonderful and kept us well informed of any messages from our travel company as to when we might fly via face to face contact and phone messages on the two phones in our room. There was a pool at the back of the hotel which was well supplied with sun loungers and chairs and tables and there was a frequent supply of fresh towels too. The pool was shared with the sister hotel, the Courtyard, and we could also use their well equipped gym. We didn't spend lots of time in the hotel but the concierge, Luis, was very knowledgeable and arranged a trip to the Everglades for us which was about an hour's drive away. We were thrilled as we had spent 2 weeks in the Keys previously, staying at the Hawks Key Resort in Duck Cay which was totally awesome (see my review) and had felt that it was too long a drive to visit the Everglades from Marathon. The trip was excellent and we went on an airboat too! We had organised on our return to spend two hours at The Bayside Shopping Center; out of this world, and then the coach from the hotel collected us around 4pm and took us back to the Marriott. From the airport you could also get buses all over the place so we went to South Beach which was beautiful and the shopping malls and went on the city's metrorail which was free so we were able to see more of Miami. We also visited Dolphin Mall which was enormous; about 10 times the size of Gunwharf Key in Portsmouth! Also near to the airport was an outlet Village and a massive Nike shop which was well worth the visit. The food at the hotel was great too. There were two menus to choose from; a bar menu with dishes ready in 5, 10 and 20 minutes which ranged from $5.00 to $20.00 and a restaurant menu which had lots of choice and prices started at $8.00 for a starter to a maximum of $35.00 for a maincourse, though most were around $20.00. Drinks were reasonably priced too and they had refills on soft drinks and pineapple juice at no extra charge. There was also a Starbucks in the lobby which was open until around 4pm. The staff were very friendly and always happy to chat and make recommendations. I would recommend this hotel either for a one night stopover travelling through (which many people did) or if you are delayed in flying due to volcanoes!! We had a lovely time there and were so pleased to not only have an extra week of our holiday due to the volcano but to be able to spend it in such a friendly and well equipped hotel. Thank you to everyone!!!! Free papers were available daily

Reviews.Title: “Not good. No more than 1 star.”
Reviews.Author: Worldhotelsreview
Reviews.Content: The room is small but sufficient. There is no fridge on the room. Mattress was ok but smelly and old pillows. The bathroom is so small that is difficult for only one person to get into it, let aside for two people to using it at the same time. When open the bathroom door almost reaches the toilet and blocks the access to the bathtub, very uncomfortable. Entering the lobby you get an extremely strong acid smell to sweat and dirt, it would accompany you all the way to your room. The hotel staffs are poorly trained, educated and unaccommodating. We asked simple questions as to where our room was facing, or if we got a room in a higher floor can we get a view and we get sort of a laughs for answer. You have to pay for parking lot at this hotel (USD 13.00) per day and you have also to pay for the wireless internet. There are two computers in the lobby with free access to internet. I read in prior post that the hotel was renovated. If it was, they can just commence to renovate it again. The hotel looks old, smell old and is old. In our room the caulking on the bathtub was mouldy and peeling off in some areas. Lot of dust on the vents. The bathtubs valves seemed as from the First World War and abused during all this time.

Reviews.Title: “OK airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: Pros- close to airport; comfortable bed; in-hotel restaurant surprisingly good for dinner; morning buffet a bit better than the average business hotel. Cons- bathroom is small (similar to most European hotels); airport shuttle pick-up service was surprisingly poor (I waited 45 minutes for a shuttle that was supposed to run every 30 minutes, and then when the shuttle arrived outside of the TAM check-in desks, it was full. I needed to take a taxi to airport, but the hotel reimbursed my taxi fare). Hallways look a bit worn

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services provided”
Reviews.Author: monocle
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the Miami Airport Marriott. It provided easy transport from MIA and timely and efficient transport to the Port of Miami. The hotel's cruise special is excellent--including breakfast and the transports listed above. Highly recommended--especially for those who are here for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor concierge, etc”
Reviews.Author: VickyMcG
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the lobby/dining area. Ultra modern if you like that style. The food is really good at Cane's, albeit pricey. We stayed twice (pre & post cruise). the first room was in the concierge level since we're frequent Marriott members. They did not give us the King or extra pillows promised, but that was not a big deal. ( I had booked this room several months ago with my choices of beds, extra pillows). The second night, we got the king, but they sent us to one of their PURE rooms. It had one of those air cleaning machines. I have to say my hubbie does suffer allergies and cannot tolerate even slightly dirty A/C filters, but he rarely has a problem at a nice Marriott anyway. I think it's unnecessary. They say they have specially treated sheets. Probably use Frabreeze and/or, put the dryer on high. Actually, that's all they can do. Hubbie was as comfy in this room as the other. They did not charge us the extra $ for the room, lucky us. Problem is, I noted the room was smaller (6th flr) than the concierge level rooms so we lost out on the extra room-no problem, it was one night, it's just that there were several little things we were disappointed in. The pool and the jacuzzi were nice, but in the shade all day. The ice maker didn't work on our floor. I caught a floor person (not a room cleaner) and she sent me one floor up for ice, which, jeesh, had a sign that said no ice on that floor, so I walked (I use stairs a lot) 2 floors down for the ice then went back to my room happy to have hunted down the elusive icy beast. No biggee, just funny. CONCIERGE info: The concierge lounge is good in that it offers free internet. The coffee is less than fair and was cold one of the mornings, you will probably opt for the Starbucks in the lobby. The eggs were in the typical chafing dish and were horrible. They were so dry and rubbery that they were orange colored on top. There were other items, such as cut up fruit which was not fresh and mostly nasty. I could give examples, but you get the idea. There was cereal, pastries, and milk. The pre-packaged stuff was okay, but any prepared items were stale, over-ripe or cold. In the evening, there were drinks and cheese/crackers, old-ish cut fruit but barely anything very edible. There was one (same chafing dish) full of what I would call Beef a Roni. It was dismally bad. Even my easy to please husband hated it. When I called Marriott before I booked, they said the airport shuttle came every 10-12 minutes. Wrong, it comes every 1/2 hour, and it comes on the upper level, not down a floor, so beware. The cost to the cruise ship was $11 per person but no return. It now comes at 11, 12 or 1. Do tell the front desk and get a ticket. It costs about $24 for 2 by taxi. The shuttle forgot us the second time. The hotel blamed the shuttle company (a contracted business) and the shuttle company blamed Marriott. So, after a call from the mgr (?) they came by. No apologies, just excuses. They ended up being 25 min late saying the "...ship wasn't going anywhere until 5." Seriously, not the point. To end all, when my husband talked to the mgr about the late shuttle, and suggested that the concierge needed some suggestions on cuisine, the mgr said he would add points to our stay. This did not happen. I do not know what happened there. (My husband is very gentlemanly and polite so he did not have an attitude, btw). Next time we will stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: miamiles
Reviews.Content: First time in Miami so we didn't know what to expect especially after reading the reviews. We stayed there three nights before our cruise and wouldn't hesitate to return. This hotel was comfortable with excellent food and great service. It was reasonably priced with a pre-cruise package that included their buffet breakfast for two. Parking and the shuttle to the ship were inexpensive. Computers with internet accesswere free in the lobby but we could have had service in the room for a fee. This worked well for cost cutting.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here on a flight change stopover. Getting there was tedious, the airport shuttle seemed to run less regularly than other chain hotels. On arrival the front desk was understaffed. However ...... I was taken ill during my stay and needed to call Rescue. The Security Guard (sadly I don't remember her name) was extremely helpful and empathetic to the situation. She also looked after my luggage until colleagues collected it. I didn't try any of the amenities but the bar and restaurant areas had clearly been recently upgraded to a good standard. The room was modern and comfortable - all you'd need and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovated Hotel with a Hiccup”
Reviews.Author: Caraib321
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very nice hotel property designed like a campus with other Marriott properties within a stoneâ€™s through of each other. A Courtyard and Residence Inn share the large fitness center and pool with the Marriott. A Fairfield Inn sits close by, but doesnâ€™t share anything with the Marriott, Courtyard and Residence Inn. For some odd reason, this newly renovated Marriott offers allergy friendly rooms called â€œPureâ€�. At check in I was totally confused due to the explanation of this room type â€“dust free and some king of special treatment â€“ all for $20 more. No one wants to stay in a room filled with pollen and dust. The front desk clerk assured me all the rooms were dust free. The whole concept seemed confusing, but clearly a way for the Miami Airport Marriott to slap guest with a $20 upgrade fee if other rooms are sold out. As a Platinum member I got a free upgrade to a mini suite. It was very nice. It had a living room with sofa, two flat screens, large dining table, nice bedroom and huge large bathroom. Everything was perfect, except the lock to the door. Here's the hiccup! I was unhappy that the door to my room was open all day. I noticed this when I returned that evening at 6:30 pm. The key didnâ€™t work. However, when I leaned on the door to try to figure out what was wrong, it opened. I called security right away to investigate the situation. At 6:45 pm Mr. Kent from security arrived and checked the door. He tried the key and found it didnâ€™t work. He then pushed on the door and found it opened into the room. He took the lock apart and noticed that a new lock needed to be installed. During the course of about an hour, Marriott security drilled holes in the door jam and installed a locking system that worked properly. This was an inconvenience for me as a hotel guest. However, I wanted to make sure it was fixed before we left to go back out. No one followed up to see if we were pleased with the outcome. General manager John Mulrey was unavailable. I later found out his is no longer with Marriott though his name appears in the room literature. Bad job Marriott Airport for not having an up to date management list in the Guest Services book. The front desk threw in some bonus Marriott reward points and free dinner at the restaurant for the hassle. I wasn't thrilled to get what they gave us for having to interrupt the evening for the repair. It wasnâ€™t enough of a â€œThank Youâ€� to have taken time out of our schedule to deal with this situation/ After all, we made sure the room would be secure for future guests. They said I got a free room upgrade, but I got that prior to the discovering the door was broke. Aside from this Marriott mishap, the hotel is nice and the food is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: rachel2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Miami airport for 1 night pre-cruise. We got the promotion for only eighty-two dollars per night for a king room, then upgrade to a 1-bed suite which was HUGE. Do get the suite if you have kids with you because it gives them more space to move around. We had late-arrival so only spent the night there fdor sleeping, didn't have much time to explore around much. Things liked at this Marriott: -free airport shuttle arriving promptly -no wait at check in, check out -very large suite rooms, with full-size dining/meeting table, sofas, chairs, small kitchen with microwave, sink -very clean -marble bathrooms -well-stocked amenities (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, cotton balls, Q-tips) -comfortable beds -nice housekeeping staff who set up the roll-away bed for us -very nice lobby area with lots of sitting, beautifully decorated Things don't like: -lobby bar very close to front desk, can be very laud at times (due to some guests) Food offered at the hotel are expensive. For breakfast, we went to a Latino restaurant right outside the hotel. Just turn left after you're out of the front of the hotel and you'll see 2 tables outdoors. You can also eat inside the restaurant with air conditioning. THey accept credit cards. For 3 adults 2 kids we spent about $29 plus tips, for omellet, pancakes, sausages, bacons, milk, coffee. The next morning we took a taxi to Miami port instead of $11 pp shuttle from the hotel. Taxi fare is $26 so it saved us a few dollars. Also, we could just go to the port anytime after checking out. All in all, we liked the Marriott at Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10 p.m. om 31st December from Italy to begin a car trip of the whole Florida circumnavigation, so we decide to sleep at the airport to leave Miami soon in the morning. We booked online with a good price that included parking and internet connection through "Marriott rewards" (it is free and in big chains as Marriott and Hilton, especially in the US, it give you always high floor and some benefits). We got a last floor, totally silence and a very nice and clean room. It is a bit old fashioned (surely not an art deco hotel!) but with a correct price. The bed was soo good and we slept perfectly. A very nice stay even if far from the city (anyway it takes only 15 minutes by car to South Beach)

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: private1_90732
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was rather average in all respects. The hotel provided standard room, standard furniture and functioning fittings, even the food was average. Service was OK. Nothing to praise, nor whine about Marriott. The Hertz concession desk in the hotel was not willing to assist in allowing me to drop the car off with them rather than the airport which would have helped my time, even for a fee. I found that strange. Hertz is normally very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and sneaky, but beautiful overall”
Reviews.Author: PaxRyan
Reviews.Content: Everything was huge and very clean. (Disclaimer: In recent years I've only been in hotels in Europe and India, so I guess I'm not actually sure how these aspects compare to other American hotels.) The location was 5 miles, an easy drive to Miami Beach, and it was right on top of the highway entrance (I think it was I95) to get there. And when I say it's overpriced, I don't mean the price of the room, but of everything else. They are nice enough to have a little convenience store open all night, which was is wonderful, but the bottles of water cost $3.50!! A cocktail in the bar was $13!! Again, maybe these prices are normal in Miami, but I was surprised. The reason I say they are sneaky is that they say it costs $13 dollars for internet in your room but it's free wifi in the lobby. But, actually, if you go to the lobby and use the free wifi on your laptop and then go back to your room - you still have the free wifi, there's no reason to pay for it! Maybe this is a mistake that they will now shut down, so enjoy it while you can, but we found wifi free in the rooms - and were therefore glad we had not paid for it when they tried to get us to! Also, parking was something like $12/night, which seemed expensive as well. Good times overall though, I just share these details to help other travellers - enjoy it, it's an awesome hotel:-) (Also note that there is a pretty cool casino (slots and poker with table games, they say, coming in 2010) just a couple blocks away, in addition to gas stations, convenience stores and a couple of restaurants immediately surrounding it:-) Also, it must be soundproofed - in the parking lot you hear planes roaring over, but we never heard it in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for MIA stop over”
Reviews.Author: Stu127
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a night at this hotel as we were flying out of MIA the next morning. The hotel shuttle was prompt and the drivers friendly. The hotel is 5 minutes from the airport (you can actually see it from the terminal buildings) and was nice, clean and modern. The room was pleasant and clean and room and served the purpose for a one night stay. We ordered room service as we arrived late and the food came quickly and was really good - although quite expensive. Same goes for breakfast - probably the most expensive breakfast I have had in a while. I would recommend walking out the front of the hotel and going to the little Sabor Latino cafe - cuban food for a fraction of the price and good coffee. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for a quick stay as it is clean, friendly, and close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Elix08
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovation but once you get inside you forget all about that. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms very clean and spacious and overall we had an excellent experience. We would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone going to miami for business or pleasure. It's very close to the Miami airport but also convinient to downtown and south beach (about 15 min.). We will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but still under renovation”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: When I checked in (on a Saturday) I was warned that there would be construction noise Monday morning at 9 am, and was given the option of staying in a room away from the noise (which of course I did!). The room was OK, but not up to Marriott standards. I assume that it will be much nicer when the renovations are completed. Since the parking lot was in disarray, we were not charged ofr parking (normally $13/night). There is free internet access at 3 computers located in the lobby, but in room internet access is $9.95/day. In summary, for the $50/night I paid on Priceline it was worth it, but I wouldn't pay much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marian13
Reviews.Content: As an Elite Marriott member, we always stay at Marriott properties. We always hope for the best, but anticipate problems. There is no such thing as a perfect stay, but this came pretty darn close. After a delay in our flight, we arrived in Miami at 11 pm. Upon arrival, do not go down to Ground Transportation. Instead, walk outside the doors and wait for the shuttle. It is a red and white shuttle bus that says Miami Airport South on the front. The driver was extremely friendly and helped us with our bags. A few more quick stops and we were at the hotel, which shares the property with the Courtyard Marriott. Upon entering the facility, you will be taken aback by the beautiful interior. This is no typical airport hotel as the decor is fashionable and high end. I arrived at the front desk and Alisa, the manager, waited on me. In the shuttle they had a continuous video about the Pure rooms so I thought I would inquire about it. Instead of going to the 7th floor Concierge Level, we ended up on the 6th floor Pure level. If you or anyone you are staying with has allergies or asthma, try this room. You immediately notice a difference once inside. The air is clean and I was excited about a decent night's sleep. Before bed we went down to the restaurant, Cane Fire Grille. Incredible -- really! It was late, but we were hungry so we had a few little plates and some drinks. The black bean soup was a large bowl -- filling and tasty. The yuca planks with 3 mojos was so good I wanted more. The Ahi tuna with tostones and avocado crema was delicious and served with a spicy mango salsa. I tried the Caipirinha - a Brazilian drink that was well worth trying. Went to bed and slept soundly in the comfortable and cushiony beds. In the morning, we were up early to work out. This, unfortunately, was not the highlight of my stay. The "exercise room" is in between the two hotels by the pool. It looks as if it is housed in a previously functioning motel. Can't think of another way to phrase that. The room was hot upon entering and never got any better. The air conditioning didn't work and the two small fans were no help. The equipment and the floor needs a serious cleaning and replacement of some of the used and dated machines. The treadmill by the mirror actually has tape on it and skids (if you have used an old treadmill in the past, you know what I mean). The elliptical felt like mud and possibly needs a tune up. Some of the machines at the back wall were so old and dirty, I tried (really I did) but gave up quickly and used the free weights. Additionally, the towels in the gym are the big pool towels. Why oh why can't you have smaller towels? We loved the size of the gym and the the amount of equipment in it, but it needs a good cleaning. After showering, we went down to breakfast in the Cane Fire Grille. Our waiter, Miguel, was an absolute angel and delight. He waited on us and checked back frequently without being overly intrusive or overbearing. The breakfast buffet is $19, but includes pastries, fresh fruit, oatmeal, eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, cereal, and an omelet and waffle station. The omelet and waffle station is manned and you need to request what you would like. Unfortunately, for the better part of our meal there was no one there so we didn't get a chance to eat any of that. However, the rest of the buffet was fantastic. Normally, we are used to dry eggs, rubbery sausage, dried toast, etc. The food was spectacular! Incredibly fresh fruit including blackberries and lychees; the oatmeal was yummy and had toppings including brown sugar and raisins; perfectly cooked sausage and bacon and they were even crispy; eggs florentine -- made constantly so the tomato was slightly cold and the muffin crisp (almost impossible to achieve on a buffet); the potatoes were cooked with onions and peppers and fresh, fresh, fresh; egg wraps with eggs, cheese, and meat (ham?); a European style layout of meats, cheeses, and hard boiled eggs; an assortment of cold cereal, milk, and yogurt parfaits. The pastries were truly yummy and not the hard as rock typical finds -- they had a little pastry that tasted like baklava. Yummy! Without the eggs and waffles, the buffet is $16. Breakfast for three including coffee and juice: $54. However, we had booked a room rate that included breakfast for two and was well worth doing so. The negatives: Although the hotel is under renovation and working hard to improve the appearance of the hotel throughout the facility, I wish the Pure rooms had a full renovation throughout. The 4x4 white ceramic 80's tiles are definitely dated. Additionally, using the hot water in our room required waiting about 5 minutes for the shower. I can get past that, but I imagine if I was here on business I might not be so agreeable. When we woke up we noticed that they were paving the parking lot below us. Not much noise, but when we returned from breakfast around 10 am, the noise was hard to miss. It was coming from above us and we aren't sure what it was, but I can assure you that had I been sleeping or trying to work -- management would have heard my mouth from my room. We weren't given any notice about the noise and it is loud enough to drown out the TV at almost the highest volume. Having said that, this is a great hotel and I intend to stay here in the future as a pre- or post-cruise hotel. They do offer a shuttle to the port for $11 per person, but we opted for a taxi instead. They also have a Hertz desk inside by the lobby, a nice large Starbucks, and a constantly updated airline monitor for departures. Thanks to all of the employees at this facility for a great stay, especially Alisa and Miguel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel after renovations”
Reviews.Author: GrantL
Reviews.Content: I got a good room rate, but there is a $11/day charge for self parking and about $13 for internet (in room). There are 4 computers in the lobby which are also available for general use (large screen, nice keyboard). There is a Starbucks open from 6 to 6 in the lobby. Everything has been renovated: lobby, restaurant, rooms (new furniture, 42 inch LCD, granite countertop). Of course, it's still the standard room size, not incredibly large, but OK. Location is very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cane Fire Grill: Not your typical hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: addventuresmiami
Reviews.Content: I am at the new Cane Fire Grill at the Miami Airport Marriott scoping out the space for our Latin America Communicators lunch in a few weeks, and I love the space. The skylights make it open and full of light, and the decor and neon curves on the wine storage space you walk past to get to the seating make it fresh and bright. The staff has been extremely friendly and showed me the space where we will be having our luncheon, including recommending how we could close it off with some curtains that will still give us the feeling of being in the restaurant but provide some privacy as well.
