But I have to say that what I love most about the space is the high-top conference style table where I'm sitting right now that lets me plug in my laptop and phone charger through a row of convenient plugs right on the tabletop. The second I saw it, I was drawn - laptop roller bag in tow - to sit there. I'm also sitting here with two other people who are working online on the very hip Sony Vaio computers set up here while they're also having breakfast. The flat screen is tuned to CNN, but the volume is off, and there is some nice but not overwhelming or musacky music in the background. It is perfect for business travelers who want to get some work done while they eat - they don't have to stoop and search for an outlet or sit alone with the laptop awkwardly perched among the breakfast dishes. This space is space is ideal for business travelers looking for a great stay near the Miami Airport. This is definitely above and beyond your typical airport hotel! Angie Moncada (add)ventures

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsie1254
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this Hotel, the service was very good and after the renovation this Hotel is not an Airport Hotel. The lobby, the restaurant it very nice and pretty but what I love the most was the service. Keep the good work!! I"ll be back soon Madison

Reviews.Title: “johnump”
Reviews.Author: johnump
Reviews.Content: this was a room with a postage stamp size bathroom. at the price i paid i expect a bathroom that is larger. the hotel bar and resturant are very orverpriced. noise level is very high. construction in and around hotel didn't help. i will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE THAN ONE STAR! Inconsiderate managers!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler1954
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS "HOTEL". The building is under construction and it is a major hassle getting around it all. My car was covered with dirt and debris. No one knew or cared where the "park and fly" part of the parking area was INCLUDING the woman at the "security gate". Worst of all, the front desk does NOT know what they are doing. When I presented a major problem to the front desk "manager" I was put off and my concerns were virtually IGNORED. She was NOT helpful and in fact very defensive. She should be fired! She told me that she would present my problem to the assistant manager of the facility and they would get back to me. When I heard NOTHING from them, I called and spoke with the "assistant manager". She obviously was never informed of my situation! When I explained SHE TOO was very defensive and not the least bit apologetic. I was told that she would get back to me, but to this day, had not! This is what the Marriott considers the "hospitality business"????? LOOK ELSEWHERE FOR A ROOM!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Carlyelvis
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this proximity to the Miami Airport, with free shuttle service to the airport terminals. Some rooms are recently renovated, but still have that old Marriott look and feel. Current MAJOR construction going on at the hotel makes parking almost impossible w/o valet service, check-in desk relocated to accommodate the construction work, and hotel lobby virtually non-existent. Would stay here agin, but after work is completed (winter 08/09). Rates reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: DutchBlokeEindhoven
Reviews.Content: Nice Airport Hotel Nice if you're forced to stay overnight due to a cancelled or delayed flight. Clean and comfortable room. Free shuttle service to airport. No free internet access in room which would be nice when you're stuck in place like this with nowhere to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelsoMO
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was just ok, but the front desk personnel was not friendly or helpful. I was there for a conference and someone from the hotel came in to clean the lightbulbs in the middle of the presentation. I think the staff could do with some customer service training. The one exception is the bell staff. They were always friendly and always willing to try to help. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeze
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for a pre cruise night. I have to say having read some of the reviews I was a little concerned as to what I was going to. However I had no complaints. Perhaps there are different standard rooms (we stayed in the business wing) but our room was very comfortable and the beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept in. The bathroom may not be large but it had all we needed with nice toiletries. The staff I dealt with at reception were very friendly and helpful. We had the buffet breakfast which to me was ok, no worse no better than most. The staff were fine. If you want to stay in the airport area this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clever trick for free Internet”
Reviews.Author: cheka
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this hotel a few years ago and didn't want to pay $13 for in-room Internet access. Since this hotel shares the property and pool with a Courtyard and Fairfield Inn, I just walked across the pool area with my laptop. Sitting in the Courtyard lobby, I happily connected to free WiFi. The free access point was also available from the pool area. Just a tip :-)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice night at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: M_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the airport Marriott this past week and I enjoyed it very much. Also during my week in the Miami I stayed at the airport Hilton and a Hilton Garden Inn and while all 3 were great, I preferred the Marriott. The good: The service was great. Check-in was smooth and I was upgraded to the concierge floor which had complimentary chicken wings, cheese and crackers, soft drinks, coffee, water, and an honor bar with beer and wine that was open until 10 PM as well as a hot breakfast w/scrambled eggs, cereal, danish, fruit, etc.. in the morning. The room was clean the TV stations seemed to be more expansive than most hotels, and everything worked. Good water pressure, enough hot water, extra towels. The not-so-good: location? Its very close to the airport and the neighborhood isn't the best. It wasn't an issue for me since I was in town on business and had lots of work to do at the hotel, but if you are the kind of person that likes to get out and about in the area adjacent to the hotel, this didn't seem like a good area. small room: My room was pretty small. I didn't really mind since it was a business trip, but if I were there for a few days and was traveling with my wife or kids I probably would have preferred to have more elbow room. Overall I rate this an excellent hotel for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, trust me, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: I read the poor reviews before I booked my stay, but thought, "it's a Marriott, it can't be that bad." Unfortunately, it was that bad. And this is from a person who loves Marriott. I stay at Marriotts all the time for business, and this is absolutely the worst one I've been to. Please take my advice and stay away. The most telling thing for me was the cab driver who told me, as I was leaving, that everyone he picks up complains about this hotel. The cab driver first asked me how I liked that hotel, and when I said it wasn't as good as Marriott usually is, he immediately said, "everyone I pick up complains about this place." I don't like to complain, and I have left lots of good reviews on tripadvisor, and I've left a few that weren't so flattering, but for a hotel that claims to be a 4 star, this place is pathetic. If you like your bathroom to be smaller than your closet, a room that looks like it was stuck in a 1970's movie, poor un-attentive service, and cleanliness that is less than is desired, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: am84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in January for a business conference. The rooms are large and the beds are very big and comfortable. All of the conference rooms were large and the staff was very accomodating. Most of the catered food was good, but the prices in Pitches (the hotel sports bar) are very high for slow service and sub-par food. The hotel is a ways away from all of the action in Miami, but they do offer a shuttle service for $5 per person each way. One MAJOR thumbs down is the fact that they do not offer free internet services. If you would like to use the internet in your room, it is roughly $13 a day. I have stayed in MUCH worse hotels than this that have offered free wireless, so I think that is a little ridiculous. Overall, this is a nice hotel but if I was going to Miami for leisure, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: BNL-Loroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. Having seen warnings about the construction I will admit the exterior windows were pretty dirty but bearable. The room still needed some updating to be on par with other Marriotts I've stayed in recently but, for the price, I would recommend for a decent night's sleep. The food was passable (the breakfast buffet was nice but pricey). We also stayed at the Airport Hilton. We definitely prefer the much cheaper Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Air Quality is hazardous to Health”
Reviews.Author: MJRED
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriot Miami Airport for a one night meeting. My first room was on the 5th floor West side of the hotel. The air quality was so bad leaving the elevator it almost took my breath away. When I got in my room and ran the water the air smelt like rotting eggs. I called the front desk and they sent up someone from maintenance to spray the room with an equally disgusting lemon air freshner. I felt like a bug hit by bug spray. The room was old. The carpet was dirty and sticky. The overal place stunk. I attended my dinner meeting and came back to my room only to have the hall stink even more and the AC in my room was putting out foul air. The AC was also not cooling the room. I started to have an allergic reatcion and went to the front desk to see about changing rooms. When I went back upstairs people were in the hall covering their mouths and I was gagging by the time I got to my room. In coming in and out of my room I saw the maintenance guy with the air freshner headed down the hall to another room. The hotel did change me to the 2nd floor east side into a room that was better with better air quality. I got a good night's rest but something is clearly wrong witht the west side as others in my party on other floors said they smelt odd odors too but not as bad as on my floor. This place is not worth the price, it clearly needs to be updated and they should have the health department check the air quality. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “A bad night - Very $$ for very little”
Reviews.Author: dcharles
Reviews.Content: A winter snowstorm forced us to spend the night in Miami. After calling a few nearby hotels I decided on the Marriott as I assumed that it would be a good/reliable hotel. The room was expensive, $300 but we had few options and I decided it was better than sleeping at the airport. We took the shuttle to the airport and checked in. Check in was a 30 minute procedure (b/c of the weather so not entirely their fault). The room WAS NOT CLEAN. The toilet had urine stains and pubic hair on it.... We requested they clean the room while we went to the sports bar in the lobby for dinner. We returned an hour later (service was SLOW) to find the room had not been cleaned. They then sent a maid who came in coughing and was sick. I went to the lobby to request another room. This room smelled strongly like cigar smoke (despite the fact that the hotel is smoke free). It was now midnight so we didn't try to change rooms again. We left at 5:15am to go back to the airport (the shuttle was 15-20 minutes late leaving the hotel). Miserable night and a waste of $330 (with tax).

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Slimdiva77
Reviews.Content: The rooms were loveley. The bed was the best part of the room. It was very comfortable. I fell asleep almost instantly. It took way to long to get my food at the bar. The staff was great and very helpful. I alos enjoyed the Bath and Body works in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “average for a marriott”
Reviews.Author: teriPortlandOregon
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Airport Marriott in Miami. The lobby was beautiful and the front desk went out of their way to make us comfortable. Cold water, cookies, upgrade our room to a higher floor. Our room was very average with the bathroom ceiling creepy. The dropped tiles didn't fit and there were creepy dark gaps when you looked up while in the shower. This really bothered me. Maybe its just me.The shampoo and lotion were from body works. They were extra special. The restaurant had mediocre service, we waited almost an hour for burgers. Not sure I would stay here again for over 200 dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps okay for one-night stay en route to airport.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFactor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a well-maintained lobby, although the rooms are extremely worn. I'm actually curious if the Courtyard in the complex is better appointed, especially since a lot of the Courtyards have been updated. The first room I received had issues around hair, etc., still lingering from a previous guest. The bathroom was so small that the toilet virtually touched the bathtub. That said, the front desk was more than eager to change my room and upgrade my status for the inconvenience. When calling the "one-stop" guest relations for room service, internet, and/or wake up call, the person on the line (the same person) was clearly tired of the calls. At the time I wished that I could have figured out how to call the front desk directly for simple questions like, "When does the shuttle arrive for the airport." Alas, I had to once again bother the Room Service person. The one-stop customer service only works if the person acts as if your inquiries are understandable. This was not the case when I stayed. Also, I typically don't think about hotel location in terms of security, but I did notice how the hotel was set apart from the surrounding neighborhood by a rather serious gate and check-in point. I wasn't sure what to make of it. Were the community residents tired of the traffic from the hotel? Or, was the hotel trying to separate its guests from the surrounding community? It was definitely something that stuck out to me.

Reviews.Title: “We survived Wilma!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fellow travellers, we had our trip to the Florida Keys cancelled at the very last moment and ended up staying at the Marriot Miami airport with a grandstand view of Hurricane Wilma. None of this staying in the ballroom business ; they let us stay in our room and only made an announcement (on a loud hailer) when the building started shaking and we,(2 adults and 3 small children ) crouched together in the bathroom. All this whilst we were regular peeping out at the destruction that we could see through our wall to ceiling windows. But the main reason for our high score was the fanatstic service; we came down to the lobby, with 3 hungry kids, to see complete carnage but great staff who were ready to serve breakfast, lunch and dinner despite broken lifts, no public transport and a limited bakery delivery! Marriot may seem soulless when everything runs smoothly but when the going gets tough the staff get fantastic! I'm not sure it would be my number 1 family destination but as a 1 night miami stopover on the way to some where else it will always be our 1st choice...particularly in the hurricane season! The Grealey's

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Marriot Miami Airport did not go smoothly. 1. The hotel address is 1201 NW LeJeune. Yahoo and GPS didn't recognize this address. When I called the hotel and asked what I was missing, I was rudely informed that LeJeune and 42nd Ave. are the same. (The 42nd Ave. address is recognized.) 2. I was very surprised that they didn't have valet parking. 3. I called for room service around 8pm and it took over 1 hour and 20 minutes (after being told it would take no more than 35 minutes). 4. When room service finally arrived, they had forgotten to bring me a spoon for my soup. I called again and it took another 20 minutes to get a spoon. 5. The fitness center was marginal at best. I often stay at Marriott Hotels while on business travel. I would not go back to the Marriot Miami Airport - two days was plenty.
